most_active_tickets.title: Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
Workstream activities tab is not working
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Desktop App Issues on macOS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with the Pieces OS desktop application on macOS, including Workstream activities tab not syncing, login/authentication issues with verification codes not arriving, and API errors related to Workstream summaries.  These issues may be related to recent updates or server-side problems.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and provide solutions.

related_issues.title: Workstream activities tab is not working
related_issues.text:
Workstream activities tab is not working
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I faced a sync problem, Can you check it please?

After the update, My activities wasn't updated.
It's 11pm but activities updated until 5am.
I used my computer for 0~5am and 7~11pm

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a22b6811-2841-4eb7-b214-36bf4528b702)

I think it can be same with #751

related_issues.title: Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
related_issues.text:
Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I haven't been online a lot because of personal issues. Yesterday I restarted pieces for the first time in weeks, and it said I needed to sign in before I can continue.
First the sign in link wouldn't work. Then I noticed there was a Pieces OS update too. After I clicked that update I got back to the same screen and the link would work.
So I entered my mail address and it said I should get a verification code, which never arrived. So I tried again later and still nothing happened. I decided to let it rest until today and try it again, but still the same result.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Performance Issues and Login Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing login failures due to verification codes not arriving, slow performance, and unresponsiveness, especially with 'New chats'.  The issues appear to be related to cloud-connected features.  Pieces is investigating a service interruption and possible cyber-related incident.  Data security is not impacted.  Updates will be provided.

related_issues.title: Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
related_issues.text:
Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I haven't been online a lot because of personal issues. Yesterday I restarted pieces for the first time in weeks, and it said I needed to sign in before I can continue.
First the sign in link wouldn't work. Then I noticed there was a Pieces OS update too. After I clicked that update I got back to the same screen and the link would work.
So I entered my mail address and it said I should get a verification code, which never arrived. So I tried again later and still nothing happened. I decided to let it rest until today and try it again, but still the same result.

related_issues.title: Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Version 4.2.0 (4.2.0)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been using Pieces for many months and it has been an absolute timesaver. 

Over the last few weeks, 'New chats' have become increasingly slow, often taking many minutes to get the first response.  This week, it is not responding at all, and failing with the error message: 
"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

I have attempted this with and without LTM enabled and have tried different LLM models - Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Clause 3.5 Sonnect, GPT-4o.    This has not resolved things.

I have independently run the same request with GPT-4o in the browser and the request response is very rapid, so the issue appears to be with the Pieces App, rather than with the LLM
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: 🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
related_issues.text:
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
We are currently experiencing a service interruption affecting several cloud-connected features across PiecesOS, the Desktop App, and Pieces Plugins. Specifically, users may notice degraded performance or unresponsiveness in the following areas:

- Copilot responses
- Workstream summaries
- Other cloud-assisted functionalities, such as snippet transforms and snippet discovery

The interruption is tied to unexpected issues with specific cloud services, and we are also actively investigating the possibility of a cyber-related incident as part of our root cause analysis.

We want to reassure all users that your data security and privacy are not impacted. As a precaution, our security and infrastructure teams are treating this with the highest level of urgency and diligence. We are taking all necessary steps to investigate and remediate the issue.

Our engineering and security teams are working around the clock to restore full functionality. We’ll continue to provide updates in this thread as we learn more and make progress.

You can track the status of this interruption here and we’ll notify you once normal service has resumed.

We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have urgent concerns or need support, please reach out via our usual support channels.

The Pieces Team
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving login/authentication issues impacting macOS desktop application users.  This is affecting multiple users and preventing access to the platform.
Investigate and address the root cause of API errors related to Workstream summaries on macOS.  This recurring issue is impacting core functionality.
Address the performance issues and unresponsiveness reported for the Pieces OS desktop application, particularly with 'New chats'.  This impacts user experience and productivity.
Monitor and provide updates on the ongoing service interruption affecting cloud-connected features.  Maintain transparent communication with users regarding the investigation and resolution progress.

Review and update support documentation and FAQs regarding login/authentication procedures, Workstream summaries, and troubleshooting steps for common macOS desktop application issues.  This can help reduce support ticket volume for known issues.
Consider implementing a more robust verification code delivery system or alternative authentication methods to prevent login failures due to undelivered codes.
Investigate potential server-side issues or recent updates that may be contributing to the reported problems on macOS.  This can help identify and address the root cause more effectively.

Proactively monitor application performance and error logs to identify and address emerging issues before they impact a large number of users.  This can help prevent widespread service interruptions and improve overall stability.

Gather more detailed user feedback on the specific issues they are experiencing, including steps to reproduce the problems, error messages, and any relevant system information.  This can help with troubleshooting and identifying patterns.
Prioritize resolving the open ticket related to the unresponsive Workstream activities tab on macOS.  This is a critical functionality for users and should be addressed promptly.

Allocate additional support resources or prioritize existing resources to address the influx of issues related to the macOS desktop application.  This can help reduce resolution times and improve user satisfaction.

Implement a system for tracking and categorizing user-reported issues to identify trends and prioritize development efforts.  This can help improve the overall quality and stability of the platform over time.

Consider offering temporary workarounds or alternative solutions for users affected by the ongoing service interruption.  This can help mitigate the impact on their workflow while the issues are being resolved.
Communicate clearly with users about the expected resolution time for the reported issues and provide regular updates on the progress.  This can help manage user expectations and maintain trust.

Investigate the possibility of a cyber-related incident as part of the root cause analysis for the service interruption.  Prioritize ensuring data security and user privacy throughout the investigation and remediation process.

Implement proactive measures to prevent future service interruptions, such as improved monitoring, redundancy, and incident response plans.  This can help minimize downtime and maintain a reliable user experience.
Review and optimize the performance of cloud-connected features to improve responsiveness and reduce latency.  This can enhance user experience and productivity.

Provide training to support staff on how to effectively troubleshoot and resolve common issues related to the macOS desktop application.  This can improve support efficiency and reduce resolution times.

Develop a system for proactively identifying and addressing potential issues before they impact users.  This can involve analyzing user feedback, monitoring application performance, and conducting regular testing.

Continuously monitor user feedback and support tickets to identify areas for improvement in the platform and support operations.  This can help ensure that user needs are being met and that the platform is evolving to meet their expectations.

Consider implementing a beta testing program to identify and address potential issues before new features or updates are released to the general public.  This can help improve the quality and stability of the platform over time.

Develop a comprehensive incident management plan to effectively handle future service interruptions or other critical incidents.  This should include clear communication protocols, escalation procedures, and recovery strategies.
Regularly review and update support processes and procedures to ensure they are aligned with best practices and user needs.  This can help improve support efficiency and user satisfaction.

Invest in tools and technologies that can help automate support tasks, such as ticket routing, knowledge base management, and user communication.  This can free up support staff to focus on more complex issues and improve overall efficiency.

Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team by encouraging feedback, sharing best practices, and providing opportunities for professional development.  This can help ensure that the support team is equipped to meet the evolving needs of users and the platform.

Regularly assess the effectiveness of support operations by tracking key metrics such as resolution time, customer satisfaction, and ticket volume.  This can help identify areas for improvement and measure the impact of implemented changes.
Develop a system for recognizing and rewarding outstanding performance within the support team.  This can help motivate staff and promote a culture of excellence within the support organization.

Establish clear service level agreements (SLAs) for support operations and communicate them to users.  This can help manage user expectations and ensure that support requests are handled in a timely manner.
Conduct regular user surveys to gather feedback on support operations and identify areas for improvement.  This can provide valuable insights into user needs and preferences.

Collaborate with other teams, such as development and product management, to address underlying issues that are contributing to support tickets.  This can help prevent recurring issues and improve the overall user experience.
Develop a knowledge base of common issues and solutions that can be accessed by both users and support staff.  This can help reduce support ticket volume and improve resolution times.
Implement a system for tracking user feedback and suggestions for improvement.  This can help prioritize development efforts and ensure that the platform is evolving to meet user needs.
Provide regular training to support staff on new features and updates to the platform.  This can help ensure that they are equipped to handle user inquiries effectively.

Encourage users to provide feedback on their support experiences, both positive and negative.  This can help identify areas for improvement and recognize outstanding performance within the support team.
Develop a system for escalating complex or critical issues to the appropriate teams or individuals.  This can help ensure that these issues are resolved quickly and efficiently.
Regularly review and update support documentation to ensure that it is accurate and up-to-date.  This can help reduce user confusion and improve self-service support options.

Consider implementing a community forum or other online platform where users can connect with each other and share tips and solutions.  This can foster a sense of community and reduce the burden on the support team.
Promote self-service support options by providing easy access to documentation, FAQs, and other resources.  This can empower users to resolve their own issues and reduce support ticket volume.
Analyze support data to identify trends and patterns in user-reported issues.  This can help prioritize development efforts and improve the overall quality of the platform.
